feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for Arkansas Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Tornado Watch issued April 19 at 2:14PM CDT expiring April 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Storm Prediction Center http://www.spc.noaa.gov

entry.summary: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... A LAKE WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING. * TIMING:LATE THIS MORNING INTO THE EARLY EVENING * WINDS: SOUTHERLY WINDS OF 15 TO 25 MPH...WITH SOME GUSTS OVER
entry.cap:areaDesc: Columbia; Hempstead; Howard; Lafayette; Little River; Miller; Nevada; Sevier; Union

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 12:16PM CDT expiring April 22 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS Memphis http://www.srh.noaa.gov/meg/
entry.summary: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER... MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT HELENA AFFECTING LEE...PHILLIPS...COAHOMA AND TUNICA COUNTIES THE FLOOD ADVISORY CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT HELENA * UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 12:14PM CDT expiring April 20 at 12:14PM CDT by NWS Memphis http://www.srh.noaa.gov/meg/
entry.summary: THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BELOW OSCEOLA * UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. * AT 11 AM TUESDAY THE STAGE WAS 28.9 FEET. * MINOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING AND MODERATE FLOODING IS FORECAST.

entry.summary: THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER. THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT CARUTHERSVILLE * UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. * AT 11 AM TUESDAY THE STAGE WAS 34.0 FEET. * MINOR FLOODING IS OCCURRING AND MINOR FLOODING IS FORECAST.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:51AM CDT expiring April 20 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS Little Rock http://www.srh.noaa.gov/lzk/
entry.summary: ...FROM THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LITTLE ROCK...THE FLOOD WARNING CONTINUES FOR THE FOLLOWING RIVER IN ARKANSAS... CACHE RIVER NEAR PATTERSON AFFECTING JACKSON AND WOODRUFF COUNTIES RIVER FORECASTS ARE BASED ON CURRENT CONDITIONS AND RAINFALL FORECASTED TO OCCUR OVER THE NEXT 12 HOURS. DURING PERIODS OF FLOODING...EVENING FORECASTS ARE REISSUED WITH UPDATED RAINFALL

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued April 19 at 10:16AM CDT expiring April 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson http://www.srh.noaa.gov/jan/
entry.summary: ...WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE ARKLAMISS TODAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... A WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING. * TIMING: SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BE QUITE STRONG AND GUSTY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON WELL AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE PLAINS

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued April 19 at 7:15AM CDT expiring April 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis http://www.srh.noaa.gov/meg/
entry.summary: ...STRONG AND GUSTY SOUTH WINDS EXPECTED TODAY... .LOW PRESSURE IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TODAY AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY TONIGHT. AN TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL SUPPORT STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS TODAY THROUGH EARLY EVENING ACROSS THE ENTIRE MIDSOUTH.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Clay; Craighead; Crittenden; Cross; Greene; Lawrence; Lee; Mississippi; Phillips; Poinsett; Randolph; St. Francis

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 4:51AM CDT expiring April 19 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis http://www.srh.noaa.gov/meg/
entry.summary: ...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT... A STRONG AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TODAY AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION TONIGHT. A TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. A VERY WARM AND MOIST UNSTABLE AIRMASS COMBINED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE ARE
entry.cap:areaDesc: Clay; Craighead; Crittenden; Cross; Greene; Lawrence; Lee; Mississippi; Phillips; Poinsett; Randolph; St. Francis

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 3:43AM CDT expiring April 19 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock http://www.srh.noaa.gov/lzk/
entry.summary: ...NIGHT TIME SEVERE WEATHER POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS ALL OF ARKANSAS... THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS PLACED MUCH OF ARKANSAS IN A MODERATE RISK FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT...GENERALLY WEST OF A GLENWOOD TO LITTLE ROCK TO NEWPORT LINE. OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA...THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued April 19 at 3:17AM CDT expiring April 19 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock http://www.srh.noaa.gov/lzk/
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... A WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING. * TIMING: WINDY CONDITIONS WILL BE NOTED TODAY ACROSS MUCH OF ARKANSAS. THE WINDS WILL SUBSIDE THIS EVENING.
